content.description:
Long moves and a delicate top out.  Start sitting low and right on good edge.  Make long moves heading left on decent edges and into large hueco.  Continue up and left to top out. 

  Possibility for another, considerably harder line starting down and left of the hueco.
content.location: On the North side of the wash, before reaching the Creek Boulder, across from Every Coyote.

climbs.name: Every Coyote
climbs.fa: Old School or T Kaney snaked CR Fuhst

content.description: SDS with good incut crimps, the skirt is fair game for feet.  Make a big move out and back to slopey jug. From there, continue moving left out the overhang and roll over the lip.
content.location: This problem is on the south side of the wash (your right if doing the standard approach) just before reaching the Creek Boulder.  The Creek Boulder can be seen from the start.

content.description: Big boulder with problems on one side. It should be pretty obvious why it is called the creek boulder...
